When HubSpot add some meta tags I think it's missing something right now because sharing on Linkedin is not creating the img preview for blog posts.
`<meta property="og:image" content=".../image-path.jpg">` .
<https://www.linkedin.com/post-inspector/|linkedin.com/post-inspector/>
Is expecting `name="image"` within the meta.
`<meta NAME="IMAGE" property="og:image" content=".../image-path.jpg">` .
I think that should fix it.
<@U7SL518D6>
Interesting, thanks for surfacing Gonzalo! I’ll take a look and pass this along to the engineers.

Reviewed the open graph protocol website and the resources for Twitter, FB and LinkedIn.

The open graph protocol website does not use the name attribute for anything. That doesn’t mean social networks obey that though.

Interestingly LinkedIn themselves do not  encourage folks to use the name attribute.

They give this as an example:
`<meta property='og:image' content='<//media.example.com/> 1234567.jpg'/>`
<https://www.linkedin.com/help/linkedin/answer/46687/making-your-website-shareable-on-linkedin?lang=en>

Can you send me a link to a page on HubSpot where you’re experiencing the issue of it not appearing when posting to LinkedIn?
